title: MS AccessMax()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MS AccessMax()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Find the price of the most expensive product in the "Products" table:
SELECT Max(Price) AS LargestPrice FROM Products;

Definition and Usage
The Max() function returns the maximum value in a set of values.
Note:
See also the
Min()
function.
Syntax
Max(
expression
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
expression
Required. A numeric value (can be a field or a formula)
Technical Details
Works in:
From Access 2000

❯
★
+1

content_sections.code: SELECT Max(Price) AS LargestPrice FROM Products;

summary: This tutorial covers MS AccessMax()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MS AccessMax()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MS AccessMax()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
